questions.question_text: Which three are characteristics of a newly created role? (Choose three.)

choices.F: It can be protected with a password.
choices.D: It can be renamed using the RENAME ROLE statement.
choices.E: It can be granted to user accounts.
choices.A: It can be dropped using the DROP ROLE statement.
choices.B: It is stored in the mysql.role table.
choices.C: It is created as a locked account.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACE
A, C, E
Agree, A,C,E

Selected Answer: ACE
The three correct statements are A, C, and E. A newly created role in MySQL 8.0 can be dropped using the DROP ROLE statement, is created as a locked account, and can be granted to user accounts. It is not stored in a mysql.role table, but rather in the mysql.user table. It cannot be protected with a password, as it has no password when created.

The three correct statements are A, C, and E. A newly created role in MySQL 8.0 can be dropped using the DROP ROLE statement, is created as a locked account, and can be granted to user accounts. It is not stored in a mysql.role table, but rather in the mysql.user table. It cannot be protected with a password, as it has no password when created.
hi please can anyone send me the dumps

ACE
It is created as a lock account
Correct answer is A,C,E https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/roles.html

Selected Answer: CD
If you were granted a role with a GRANT statement that includes the WITH ADMIN OPTION clause, you become able to grant that role to other users or roles, or revoke it from other users or roles, as long as the role is active at such time as you subsequently grant or revoke it. This includes the ability to use WITH ADMIN OPTION itself

Selected Answer: AC
A. Mark can grant the privileges assigned to the r_read@localhost role to another user:
This is correct because WITH ADMIN OPTION allows mark to manage the privileges associated with the role, including granting those privileges to other users.

C. Mark can grant the r_read@localhost role to another user:
This is also correct, as WITH ADMIN OPTION allows mark to grant the role itself to other users.
C and D
C and D

https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/grant.html

choices.A: Mark can grant the privileges assigned to the r_read@localhost role to another user.
choices.B: ADMIN OPTION causes the role to be activated by default.
choices.D: Mark can revoke the r_read@localhost role from another role.
choices.E: ADMIN OPTION allows Mark to drop the role.
choices.C: Mark can grant the r_read@localhost role to another user.
choices.F: Mark must connect from localhost to activate the r_read@localhost role.

questions.question_text: Which four are types of information stored in the MySQL data dictionary? (Choose four.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCDG
B, C, D, G

Selected Answer: BCDG
B-Table Definitions: The INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES provides details about tables in the database.
D-View Definitions: Information about views is also stored in the data dictionary.
G-Stored Procedure Definitions: Information about stored procedures is stored in the data dictionary.
C-Access Control Lists: While not explicitly mentioned, access control lists would be part of the metadata about database objects stored in the data dictionary.
I feel BCDG
at least BDG

choices.H: InnoDB buffer pool LRU management data

choices.B: Remove the @@GLOBAL.gtid_purged statement from the dump file.
choices.D: Remove the group replication plugin from each instance before restoring.
choices.C: Create the backup by using the --set-gtid-purged=OFF option.
choices.E: Remove the @@GLOBAL.gtid_executed statement from the dump file.
choices.A: Stop all instances except the primary read/write master instance and run the restore.

questions.question_text:
You have an InnoDB Cluster configured with three servers.
Examine this command, which executes successfully:
mysqldump -uroot -p -d mydatabase > mydatabase_backup.sql
Due to data loss, the cluster is initialized and a restore is attempted resulting in this error:
ERROR 13176 (HY000) at line 23: Cannot update GTID_PURGED with the Group Replication plugin running
Which two actions, either one of which, can fix this error and allow a successful restore of the cluster? (Choose two.)
Which statement is true about MySQL Enterprise Transparent Data Encryption (TDE)?

choices.C: Lost tablespace encryption keys can be regenerated only if the master database key is known or present in the Key Vault specification.
choices.B: Both MyISAM and InnoDB tables can be encrypted by setting the keyring_engine = ALL variable in the MySQL configuration file.
choices.D: TDE can encrypt InnoDB and MyISAM tables only when the tables are stored in the SYSTEM tablespace.
choices.A: MySQL TDE uses an appropriate keyring plugin to store the keys in a centralized location.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
1. MyISAM can't be encrypted
2. Tablespace encryption key never changes. If lost, then data is lost.

Selected Answer: A
InnoDB uses a two-tier encryption key architecture, consisting of a master encryption key and tablespace keys. When a tablespace is encrypted, a tablespace key is encrypted and stored in the tablespace header. When an application or authenticated user wants to access encrypted tablespace data, InnoDB uses a master encryption key to decrypt the tablespace key. The decrypted version of a tablespace key never changes, but the master encryption key can be changed as required. This action is referred to as master key rotation.

A. 
https://www.mysql.com/products/enterprise/tde.html#:~:text=MySQL%20Enterprise%20Transparent%20Data%20Encryption%20(TDE)%20protects%20your%20critical%20data,Data%20Security%20Standard%20(PCI%20DSS)

can't encrypt MyISAM, so BD are out.,
